ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri technology
ResearchProjectDef.description: Begin adapting off-world Tau'ri tech: field equipment, comms, and just enough military-grade hardware to get the IOA very concerned.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri Uniforms
ResearchProjectDef.description: Standard-issue SGC uniforms and armor rated for both firefights and diplomatic blunders. Includes extra pockets for snacks, Zat holsters, and moral ambiguity.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri weapons I
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock pulse-pounding, projectile-slinging freedom—courtesy of Earth’s finest ballistic engineering.\nWarning: may provoke Goa’uld, Wraith, and anyone with plasma-based superiority complexes.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri weapons II
ResearchProjectDef.description: Advances in Tau’ri weapons engineering bring the next generation of battlefield tools into your arsenal. Building on prior designs, this tier delivers more specialized options, improved stopping power, and refined technology for dealing with threats at any range. The Goa’uld call it escalation. The Tau’ri call it preparedness.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Anti-Replicator gun
ResearchProjectDef.description: A classified Tau’ri prototype built with alien assistance, designed for one purpose: dismantling Replicators on a molecular level. Unlike conventional weapons, its exotic energy pulse disrupts nanite cohesion, rendering even the most advanced swarms inert. Slow to produce and difficult to maintain, but utterly devastating against its intended target.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri turrets I
ResearchProjectDef.description: Field up your defenses the Tau’ri way: a manned, shielded M2 that turns negotiations into noise. Teaches emplacement, feed, and “brace for recoil.”

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri turrets II
ResearchProjectDef.description: Apply refined naquadah to rail physics and call it “security.” Unlocks a manned railgun that ventilates armor and egos at extreme range.

ResearchProjectDef.label: MALP mech tech
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock the secrets of Tau’ri engineering with the MALP — a rugged, shielded exploration probe that operates beyond normal mechinator limits. While the Tau’ri keep their full control systems classified, they’ve released enough blueprints for colonists to assemble a serviceable copy. It won’t complain about shifts, gets along fine with radiation, and doubles as the first “volunteer” through any Stargate.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Naquadah refinement
ResearchProjectDef.description: Learn to refine raw Naquadah into Naquadria—an unstable but potent power source.\nGreat for experimental engines, questionable ethics, and catastrophic explosions.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Naquadria generator
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock a compact, high-yield power generator fueled by weaponized star dust. Enough energy to power a base—or vaporize one by accident.

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tau'ri Puddle Jumper
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlock Tau’ri plans for a Puddle Jumper—an Ancient scout ship refitted with a deflector shield, VTOL agility, and just enough documentation to build it (but not to fly it through wormholes). The Tau’ri withheld the Ancient navigation suite, and this model can’t fit through the Rim’s undersized, Archotech-locked Stargates anyway. Ideal for stealth insertions, rapid exfil, and planetary/orbital hops—less ideal for “dial-and-dash.”

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tretonin synthesis
ResearchProjectDef.description: Unlocks the secrets of Tretonin, a breakthrough serum reverse-engineered from Goa'uld symbiote research.\nProvides total immunity to disease—at the cost of permanent biochemical dependency.\nTau'ri scientists call it a miracle. Symbiotes call it unemployment.

rulesStrings.li: subject_story->extracted larval enzymes from a recovered symbiote and mapped their effects on host immunity
subject_story->observed a Jaffa host resisting sepsis via symbiote-mediated immune modulation and recorded biomarkers
subject_story->isolated a naquadah-binding carrier protein that distributes enzymes system-wide
subject_story->reproduced the enzyme cascade in vitro; early trials cured disease but caused acute dependency
subject_story->cross-referenced Tok'ra field notes on rejection, dosing, and withdrawal mitigation

ResearchProjectDef.label: Tracked cart
ResearchProjectDef.description: Blueprints for a compact, tracked haul platform—part motor-pool ingenuity, part “don’t ask what’s in the crate.” Chemfuel-powered, stable on rough ground, and perfect for dragging too much loot back to base without rupturing a colonist’s spine.
